notes: Reproduced on all tested versions (2.88.2, 2.88.3, 3.119.2, and main source). SKMatrix.MapRect normalizes the output rectangle, swapping Left/Right and Top/Bottom when the input rect is non-standard (Left > Right or Top > Bottom). The reporter's claim that 2.88.2 was a 'last known good' version is incorrect â€” the bug exists there too. The underlying cause is that Skia's SkMatrix::mapRect (called via sk_matrix_map_rect) always returns a sorted/normalized rect. This is a genuine bug since an identity matrix transform should preserve all rect properties.

versionResults.notes: Reporter claimed this was last known good, but bug exists here too. Left/Right and Top/Bottom swapped.
Reporter's version. MapRect normalizes the non-standard rect as reported.
Latest stable release. Same normalization behavior.
Built from source and ran xUnit test. Assert.Equal(25, resultRect.Left) failed with Actual: 15. Bug still present on main.

reproductionSteps.description: Create standalone console project with SkiaSharp 2.88.3
reproductionSteps.command: dotnet new console -n Repro --framework net8.0 && cd Repro && dotnet add package SkiaSharp --version 2.88.3
reproductionSteps.output:
The template "Console App" was created successfully.
PackageReference for package 'SkiaSharp' version '2.88.3' added.

filesCreated.description: Console project targeting net8.0 with SkiaSharp 2.88.3
Reproduction code that creates a non-standard SKRect (Left>Right, Top>Bottom) and maps it with an identity matrix

reproductionSteps.output:
Input:  Left=25, Top=10, Right=15, Bottom=2
Result: Left=15, Top=2, Right=25, Bottom=10
Left match:   False (expected 25, got 15)
Right match:  False (expected 15, got 25)
Top match:    False (expected 10, got 2)
Bottom match: False (expected 2, got 10)
FAIL: MapRect normalized the rect (swapped values)

Top match:    False (expected 10, got 2)
Bottom match: False (expected 2, got 10)

errorMessages.primaryError: SKMatrix.MapRect normalizes non-standard rectangles: input Left=25, Right=15, Top=10, Bottom=2 becomes Left=15, Right=25, Top=2, Bottom=10
additionalErrors: The normalization occurs because Skia's underlying SkMatrix::mapRect internally sorts the mapped rect via SkRect::makeSorted()

triageCorrections.upstream: Reporter claimed 2.88.2 was last known good version
triageCorrections.corrected: Bug also reproduces on 2.88.2. The normalization behavior exists across all tested versions (2.88.2, 2.88.3, 3.119.2, main).
